resources.string: Oh no! You are awoken from sleep and there\'s a fire in your house! Your first step is to:
You have to get out of your bedroom, but your door is warm to the touch. What do you do?
Let\'s say your only choice is to walk through smoke. What do you do?
Uh oh! Your clothing has caught on fire! What do you do?
Now you are safely your house. What is your next step?
Call the fire department
Get out of the house
Gather all your most important belongings
Go out your window.
Go out the door.
Wait for the firefighters to show up and save you.
Run through the smoke as fast as you can.
Walk backwards through the smoke.
Stay low to the ground and crawl towards your exit.
Stop what you\'re doing, drop to the ground, and roll until the flames go out.
Run out of the house as fast as you can.
Run to the nearest bathroom and dump water on yourself.
Run as far away from your burning house as possible.
Go to your family\'s previously designated meeting spot and call 911.
Celebrate! You made it safely out of the fire!
You may not have time to call the fire department. Try again.
Good job! The first thing you do should be to get yourself safely out of the house.
You may not have time to gather your belongings. Your own safety should be the priority! Try again.
Great idea! A warm door likely means the fire is right outside your room, so going out through the window would be the best idea.
If the door is warm to the touch, the fire is likely right outside your room, and you should open that door. Try again.
Only stay where you are if there is no way to exit the building safely. Otherwise, your priority is getting yourself out. Try again.
This is not a good idea. You may end up inhaling a lot of smoke, which will be bad for your health. Try again.
Walking backwards won\'t prevent you from inhaling smoke, which is bad for your health. Try again.
Great choice! Smoke rises towards the ceiling, so staying low to the ground helps you avoid inhaling it.
Great choice! If your clothes catch on fire, you should stop, drop, and roll to put out the flames.
Running will only make the fire burn faster. Try again.
Your bathroom might be too far away. This is not the fastest way to put out the flames.
Don\'t run away, because people will not know whether you made it out of the house safely.
Good choice! Going to a meeting spot allows you and your family to know if everyone made it out of the house safely.
Don\'t run away, because people will not know whether you made it out of the house safely. Instead, call 911 once you get out of the building.
